questions.uddipok:
Identify the unclear pronoun references in the following passage. Where necessary, rewrite the sentence so that all pronoun references are clear.

Computer is a wonderful invention of modern science. Nowadays, no civilized nation can think even a day without it. As it is utterly important in our day-to-day life one should get more access to it. Its necessity is immeasurable. We must have wide knowledge about it. Trade or commerce, science or technology everything in the world is unthinkable without the help of computer. We must take the advantage of it. No one can keep pace with the fast changing world without getting this. But use of computer in our country is not up to our expectation. Most of us in our country do not have any knowledge of computer. Computer literacy is must for the students for the all-round development of any nation. So we must provide computer to them somehow or other.

sub_questions.explanation:
Unclear Pronouns:
"As it is utterly important in our day-to-day life one should get more access to it." Unclear reference: "it" Rewrite: "As the computer is utterly important in our day-to-day life, one should get more access to computers."
"Its necessity is immeasurable." Unclear reference: "Its" Rewrite: "The necessity of the computer is immeasurable."
"We must take the advantage of it." Unclear reference: "it" Rewrite: "We must take advantage of computers."
"No one can keep pace with the fast changing world without getting this." Unclear reference: "this" Rewrite: "No one can keep pace with the fast-changing world without getting knowledge of computers."
"So we must provide computer to them somehow or other." Unclear reference: "computer" and "them" Rewrite: "So we must provide computers to students somehow or other."
Rewritten Passage:
Computer is a wonderful invention of modern science. Nowadays, no civilized nation can think even a day without computers. As the computer is utterly important in our day-to-day life, one should get more access to computers. The necessity of the computer is immeasurable. We must have wide knowledge about computers. Trade or commerce, science or technology, everything in the world is unthinkable without the help of computers. We must take advantage of computers. No one can keep pace with the fast-changing world without getting knowledge of computers. But the use of computers in our country is not up to our expectation. Most of us in our country do not have any knowledge of computers. Computer literacy is a must for students for the all-round development of any nation. So we must provide computers to students somehow or other.

questions.uddipok:
Suppose, you are a reporter of a national daily. Now, write a report on a terrible fire accident in a garments
factory in your locality.

sub_questions.explanation:
A Devastating fire, taking 30 lives



Zabir Khandakar, Dhaka, Mohakhali, 15 October : A devastating fire broke out in Jahan Garment Factory at Mohakhali in the city of Dhaka on 14 October. At least 30 people were killed and over 50 injured. The death toll may rise.


The fire broke out at about 9:00 pm. It is anticipated that the fire might have originated from an electric short circuit at the “Finishing Section” on the second floor of the building.


Smoke engulfed the whole 10 storey building as a result of which people inside the building could not come out of it in spite of their best efforts. The local people and some workers of the factory rushed to the spot but failed to bring the fire under control.


Kamal Hossain, a neighbor of the factory said, “We were in our house. All on a sudden we saw the fire at the 2 nd floor first and then it spread rapidly.”


The Fire Brigade and Civil Defense rushed to the spot immediately to extinguish the fire. The Bangladesh Army, the Bangladesh Air Force also sent their personnel and helicopters to rescue the people.


Rahima, a worker of the garment said, “We saw the fire and wanted to come out but the supervisor locked us.” As the fire spread rapidly, panicked workers were trying to escape. But the only exit was locked, the sources claimed. The wounded were admitted into the nearest hospital and different clinics of the city. The causes of the accident were not ascertained.


A cas was filed in Gulshan Police Station in this connection. The government has formed a five member investigation committee to find out the cause of the fire.

questions.uddipok: Write a paragraph in 250 words on "Digital Bangladesh".

sub_questions.explanation:
Digital Bangladesh
"Digital Bangladesh" is a visionary initiative launched by the government of Bangladesh to transform the country into a knowledge-based society through the use of information and communication technology (ICT). The concept, introduced by Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina in 2008, aims to harness the power of digital technology to improve various sectors, such as education, healthcare, governance, and business, thereby promoting overall national development. One of the key aspects of Digital Bangladesh is the expansion of internet connectivity across the country, including rural areas, which has enabled millions of people to access information, communicate, and participate in the digital economy.
The government has made significant investments in building infrastructure for digital services, including the development of e-governance systems, digital banking, and online education platforms. These initiatives have not only increased the efficiency of public services but have also provided greater transparency and accountability. In education, online learning platforms and digital classrooms have made learning more accessible, especially during the COVID-19 pandemic, when schools shifted to virtual classes.
Furthermore, the rise of the digital economy has created new opportunities for young entrepreneurs in e-commerce, freelancing, and digital marketing. The government's efforts to develop digital skills among the youth through training programs have led to an increase in the number of IT professionals, contributing to the country’s growing tech industry.
Despite the progress, challenges remain, such as digital literacy gaps, cybersecurity concerns, and the need for further infrastructure development in remote areas. However, the vision of Digital Bangladesh continues to evolve, aiming for an inclusive, technology-driven future for all its citizens.

questions.uddipok: Write a composition on "Our Population – a Prospect or a Problem" narrating why it is important, its main features and your opinion about the present situation of Bangladesh.

sub_questions.explanation:
Our Population – A Prospect or a Problem?
Population is one of the most significant factors that determine the growth and development of a country. In the case of Bangladesh, its population has been both a source of potential and a challenge. With a population of over 170 million people in a relatively small area, Bangladesh is one of the most densely populated countries in the world. The importance of this population lies in its potential to drive economic growth, promote cultural diversity, and provide a young workforce that can contribute to national development. However, the situation is more complex, and the population also presents several challenges.
One of the main features of Bangladesh’s population is its youthful demographic. Nearly 40% of the population is below the age of 25, which is a huge advantage for the country. A young workforce can be an engine for economic growth, especially in sectors like manufacturing, services, and technology. This demographic can also fuel innovation, entrepreneurship, and a diverse labor market. Furthermore, the cultural richness and diversity of Bangladesh’s population are vital for the country’s heritage and social fabric.
However, rapid population growth has its downsides. With limited resources and a lack of proper infrastructure, the country faces problems such as unemployment, poverty, overcrowding, and strain on healthcare and education systems. The pressure on the environment due to deforestation, pollution, and inadequate waste management is also a growing concern. Despite improvements in various sectors, poverty rates remain high, and access to quality healthcare and education is still a challenge for many people, particularly in rural areas.
In my opinion, Bangladesh’s population is both a prospect and a problem. The country has immense potential if it can harness the power of its young population by investing in education, skill development, and job creation. At the same time, it must address the challenges associated with overpopulation by promoting family planning, improving healthcare, and developing sustainable infrastructure. If managed properly, the population can be an asset, but without effective policies and investments, it could remain a serious challenge to the country's progress.
